node.title: 'The crocodile had him in his mouth', but this brave Staffy bit back
node.description: Banjo the Staffordshire bull terrier took on a three-metre salt water croc on a popular Darwin beach and survived with just a few cuts.
node.content:
["A dog has been attacked by a crocodile on a popular Darwin beach but lived to bark the tale.", "Warning: This article contains an image that some readers may find distressing\u00a0", "Banjo the Staffordshire bull terrier went in for a dip at Casuarina Beach about 9am today, just as the neap tide started its journey inward.", "Owner Tom Cummins takes five-year-old Banjo there for his daily constitutional.", "\"The water was knee-deep. He just ran into the water to cool off. I heard a bit of a growl and looked around and a crocodile had him in its mouth,\" the 78-year-old retired electrician said.", "", "
Crocodile bites on Banjo the staffy after an attack on Casuarina Beach.(Supplied: Di Spicer)
", "Banjo has three lacerations on his back as a reminder of the bout.", "Mr Cummins estimated the saltwater croc was about three metres long and\u00a0hung around about 10m from the water's edge as the pair left.", "\"Waiting for his next victim,\" Mr Cummins said.", "\"Banjo probably jumped straight onto the crocodile.", "\"If he had been a poodle or the water was deeper that would have ended differently.", "", "
Tom Cummins says his staffy Banjo is a very strong dog.(Supplied: Di Spicer)
", "
Straight back in
", "Banjo obviously was not too fazed, as he went for another swim in Rapid Creek on the walk home.", "The pair stopped at the vet for a check-up where the wound was deemed \"purely cosmetic\" and did not require stitches.", "\"He'll pick up a few girls with those scars,\" Mr Cummins said.", "Mr Cummins, originally from Abbeyleix in Ireland but now calling Nightcliff home, does not carry his phone on walks so did not get a photo of the croc.", "Casuarina Beach is a very popular place for dogs, swimmers, paddleboarders, kite surfers, surf lifesavers, and families.", "", "
Parks and Wildlife Ranger Ian Hunt on duty on Darwin Harbour.(ABC News: Mitchell Woolnough)
", "
Hunt by name\u00a0\u2026
", "", "
Casuarina Beach is a poular place.(Flickr:\u00a0Geoff Whalan)
", "NT rangers and the crocodile management unit were unable to find the crocodile this morning.", "NT Wildlife ranger Ian Hunt estimated the crocodile was just longer than two metres.", "\"Around this time of year with the temperatures warming up and the increased rainfall, we are finding crocs moving around a lot more,\" Mr Hunt told ABC Radio Darwin's Drive presenter Liz Trevaskis.", "\"It is the breeding season for the saltwater crocodiles and sometimes they can be a lot more aggressive and a bit more bold or brave, which might explain why this attack has happened on the beach this morning."]
